comment._content: It would have taken, what, thirty minutes for a man to dress that way each morning?

comment.author: 89157585@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Eye Candy Art Post (share 1 comment 1), and we'd love to have this added to the group! wonderful photo! (comments are not necessary in the group) I love so many of these photos you post and thought it would be nice if more people were able to see them. You have my open invitation to add to the group any you feel you would like more exposure of.

comment.author: 92987904@N00
comment._content: This should be MarQuis Max Strozzi, who married Miss Linda Arnold on June 18, 1913 (at least according to the announcement in the Time a month before. "The Marquis is the son of Marquis Pio and Marchioness Rita Stozzi of Palazzo Strozzi, Florence." ALL SOCIAL ROADS NOW LEAD TO PASTURES GREEN -- New York Times, May 25, 1913 (How did I ever live without the New York Times archive?)

comment.author: 34057198@N07
comment._content: I'd love to understand how this kind of portrait photography was done... what kind o film, light, processing... the skin is always so "clean"..

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: And they were married in June 1913: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9400E0D8103BE6... (Bottom of third column from the right) It's "Marquis," by the way.

comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: One of the downsides of being a Marquis was spending a half an hour dressing each morning.  He probably had a Dresser to help him.
